result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger A. Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:26am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed


PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>>NO CONTEST

State notes no charge will be filed relative to the PAC relating to this charge.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 3 years probation
CONDITIONS: $2452 inclusive of all costs; 9 month MCJ w/huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; 36 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA and be in full compliance w/any resulting drivers safety plan; Absolute sobriety; Any other assessment/treatment counseling as deemed appropriate by PO;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 36 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid.

Adj: 8:34am
Plea hearing on August 1, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Plea set
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection

$5,000 signature bond with first $500 in cash.  No alcohol consumption.  AMENDED: Defendant allowed to drive a motor vehicle for purposes of counseling or day report and ONLY if he is absolutely sober, provided he has a valid DL.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - within 24 hours of release - Day Report Program.

Case called: 10:33am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus.
(Motion to Amend Bond)

Atty Cveykus' Motion regarding amending bond to allow defendant to drive if he has a valid DL - Argument by Atty Cveykus; State takes no position on request. 
COURT questions re: defendant's DL - Defendant still has valid DL; COURT questions if defendant is administratively suspended - both parties note blood tests have still not been returned so defendant still has valid DL; State will follow up with Crime Lab

COURT amends bond to allow defendant to drive a motor vehicle for purposes of counseling or day report and only if he is absolutely sober, provided he has a valid DL.
